result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darwyn G Nelson Jr

records.addlTxt:
4:16 PM Defendant Darwyn G Nelson Jr appeared by phone.  Attorney Ryan J. Moertel appeared by video for Darwyn G Nelson Jr.  Attorney Emily Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin. Waive formal reading of the CC. DE will waive TL for PH. DE has colloquy with DE on his right to appear in person, DE requested to appear via ZOOM today, waives personal appearance.  Court instructs on waiver of TL for PH, DE understands, court accepts.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 11, 2023 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on January 11, 2023 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on November 1, 2022 at 04:15 pm.

2:11 PM Defendant Darwyn G Nelson Jr in court.  Attorney Ellen Anderson in court for State of Wisconsin. DE will have court appointed counsel, will repay at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing 11/01/22.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 04:15 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 25, 2022 at 04:15 pm.

9:58 AM Defendant Darwyn G Nelson Jr in court.  Attorney Emily Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court has approved court appointed counsel, attempting to obtain counsel.  DE will repay at the rate of $50.00 a month commencing 11/01/22.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 27, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Initial appearance on September 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.

1:05 PM Defendant Darwyn G Nelson Jr in court.  Attorney Ellen Anderson in court for State of Wisconsin. DE states he was denied PD services.  DE will apply for court appointed counsel.  DE informs the court he was put on leave/terminated from Weathershield, DE states he contacted the PD office this morning as to his termination of employment but was still denied as he owns his home.  The court will request the income determination from the PD office. DE will complete the application for court appointed counsel and the court will make a determination as to eligibility for court appointed counsel.  Set for  Adj Init App September 13, 2022 @ 10:00am. Adj 1:20pm.

No contact with B.A.H. dob 5/2/2011, or her residence or her family, and no contact with minors except for incidental contact in public places and the exception of his 15 year old son Alexander.  Court ordered a DNA sample be taken from DE immediately.

1:03 PM The DE appeared via Zoom from the Rusk County Jail.   Inv. Zach Dieckman from RC Sheriff's Dept. appeared via Zoom.  The State appeared by DA Ellen Anderson via Zoom.  PD Attorney Dustin Rockow appeared via video.   Court found PC on 8/22/22.   A bail bond/hearing is set for today.  Court informed DE he would need to contact PD office to see if he qualifies, or he may qualify for a Court Appointed Attorney, or he may represent himself.   State summarized charges that will be filed today.  State req. a $5000 cash bond with conditions of no contact with B.A.H. dob: 5/2/2011, the residence of B.A.H., no contact with the family of B.A.H. (parents and any siblings), and no contact with minors.  1:08 PM Attorney Rockow and DE enter breakout room.   1:13 PM Back on the record.  Attorney Rockow argument as to bond.  State argument.  Court makes findings.  Judge ordered a $2500 cash bond with conditions of no contact with B.A.H. dob 5/2/2011, or her residence or her family, and no contact with minors except for incidental contact in public places and the exception of his 15 year old son Alexander.  Court ordered a DNA sample be taken from DE immediately.   INIT set for 8/30/22 at 1:00 PM.  Adj. 1:22 PM
